title: Ghostly Ballroom Adventure #63
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Grand Ballroom
rooms.description: A magnificent ballroom frozen in time. Crystal chandeliers hang from the vaulted ceiling, their prisms catching moonlight that streams through tall windows. The polished marble floor reflects ghostly images of dancers who are no longer there. Elegant columns line the walls, and the air is cold despite the summer night. You can almost hear the echo of a waltz playing.

items.name: grand piano
items.description: A beautiful black grand piano sits in the corner, its keys covered in dust

items.name: yellowed sheet music
items.description: An old piece of music for a waltz
items.text: The Blue Danube Waltz - Performed at the Grand Opening, 1889. Conductor: Maestro Viktor Blackwood. This ballroom has hosted the finest society gatherings for generations.

items.name: refreshment table
items.description: A long table that once held champagne and delicacies, now covered with a dusty cloth

items.name: gilded invitation card
items.description: An elegant invitation to a ball
items.text: You are cordially invited to the Midsummer Ball at Blackwood Manor. Dancing begins at midnight. Dress: Formal evening attire required. All guests must present themselves to the Master of Ceremonies in the gallery above.

items.name: ornate display cabinet
items.description: A tall cabinet with glass doors displaying trophies and memorabilia from past balls

items.name: ballroom chronicle
items.description: A leather bound book documenting the ballroom's history
items.text: Blackwood Manor Ballroom - Opened 1889. Built by Lord Edmund Blackwood as the finest ballroom in the county. Maestro Viktor Blackwood, the lord's brother, served as conductor for all grand occasions. The combination to the middle shelf is the year of our grand opening.

items.name: ornate silver key
items.description: A decorative silver key with musical note engravings

items.name: velvet chest
items.description: A chest covered in deep blue velvet with silver clasps

items.name: conductor's journal
items.description: A personal journal belonging to Maestro Viktor Blackwood
items.text: My final entry: The Midsummer Ball of 1889 will be my greatest triumph. I have prepared the orchestra in the gallery above. But I fear something terrible will happen tonight. If you are reading this, seek the musician's gallery where I conducted. Only a guest of honor may pass.

items.name: brass key
items.description: A brass key with a treble clef design

items.name: crystal chandelier
items.description: A massive chandelier hanging from the ceiling, its crystals tinkling softly in an unfelt breeze

items.name: marble columns
items.description: Elegant white marble columns supporting the gallery above
items.text: The columns are carved with musical motifs and dancing figures. A plaque reads: 'To reach the gallery, one must be properly attired for the ball.'

items.name: spiral staircase
items.description: An elegant staircase leading up to the musician's gallery, blocked by a velvet rope

rooms.name: Musician's Gallery
rooms.description: A curved balcony overlooking the grand ballroom below. Music stands are arranged in a semicircle, and instruments rest in their cases as if the musicians just stepped away. The conductor's podium stands at the center. Moonlight illuminates sheet music scattered across the floor. A door to the east leads to the master's private study.

items.name: conductor's podium
items.description: An elevated platform where Maestro Blackwood once stood to conduct the orchestra

items.name: silver conductor's baton
items.description: A elegant baton with Viktor Blackwood's initials engraved on it

items.name: row of music stands
items.description: Empty music stands arranged for a full orchestra
items.text: Each stand has a nameplate: First Violin, Second Violin, Viola, Cello, Flute, Oboe, Clarinet, Horn, Trumpet. All performed under Maestro Viktor Blackwood's direction.

items.name: violin case
items.description: An open case containing a beautiful violin

items.name: crumpled note
items.description: A hastily written note stuffed inside the violin case
items.text: The tragedy occurred during the Midsummer Ball. Maestro Viktor collapsed while conducting. They say his spirit still haunts the gallery. To escape, you must enter Lord Blackwood's private study. Answer the questions truthfully - who conducted here, where did the tragedy occur, and remember you are a guest of honor.

items.name: orchestra equipment chest
items.description: A large chest containing spare instruments and supplies

items.name: ball program booklet
items.description: A printed program from the fateful Midsummer Ball
items.text: Midsummer Ball Program - June 21, 1889. Orchestra conducted by Maestro Viktor Blackwood. Venue: Musician's Gallery, Blackwood Manor. Featured performance: The Blue Danube Waltz. All guests of honor are invited to meet Lord Blackwood in his private study after the performance.

items.name: portrait of Maestro Viktor
items.description: An oil painting of a distinguished gentleman in formal conducting attire
items.text: Maestro Viktor Blackwood, 1845-1889. Beloved conductor and brother to Lord Edmund Blackwood. His passion for music brought joy to all who heard him conduct in this very gallery.

items.name: mahogany study door
items.description: A heavy mahogany door with brass fittings. Three questions are engraved on a brass plaque mounted beside it.

password_questions.question: Who was the conductor of the orchestra?
password_questions.hint: Check the sheet music, journal, and portrait in the gallery

password_questions.question: Where did the tragedy occur?
password_questions.hint: The hidden note and program booklet mention the location

password_questions.question: What is your status at this ball?
password_questions.hint: The invitation and program booklet refer to your role

rooms.name: Master's Private Study
rooms.description: You have reached Lord Blackwood's private study! A cozy room lined with bookshelves and hunting trophies. A fire crackles in the fireplace, though no one tends it. Through the window, you can see the gardens and a path leading away from the manor. A secret passage behind a bookshelf stands open, revealing stone steps leading down to freedom.

items.name: mahogany writing desk
items.description: Lord Blackwood's personal desk covered with correspondence and documents

items.name: Lord Blackwood's letter
items.description: A letter written in elegant script
items.text: My dear brother Viktor conducted his final waltz tonight. The music was beautiful, but he collapsed at the podium. I cannot bear to remain in this house any longer. I am sealing the ballroom and leaving through the secret passage. May his spirit find peace.

items.name: stone fireplace
items.description: A large fireplace with a fire that burns eternally, casting dancing shadows

items.name: bookshelf with secret passage
items.description: A tall bookshelf that has swung open to reveal a hidden passage
items.text: The passage leads down through the manor's foundation and emerges in the gardens beyond. Freedom awaits.

rooms.win_message: You have escaped the Ghostly Ballroom! As you descend the secret passage, you hear one final waltz echo through the manor - Maestro Viktor's spirit conducting his eternal performance. You emerge into the moonlit gardens, free at last from the haunted ballroom. The music fades behind you as you walk away into the night. You win!
